Constructor Detail

ZipCommand

public ZipCommand(ZipCommand.Mode mode,
                  String pathToZipFile,
                  Set<String> paths,
                  boolean junkPaths,
                  int compressionLevel,
                  File workingDirectory)
Create a ZipCommand to create or update a zip archive. Note that paths added to the archive are always relative to the working directory.
For example, if you're in /dir and you add file.txt, you get an archive containing just the file. If you were in / and added dir/file.txt, you would get an archive containing the file within a directory.

Parameters:
mode - one of ZipCommand.Mode.ADD, UPDATE, FRESHEN or DELETE, as in the zip command.
pathToZipFile - path to archive to create or update
paths - a set of files and/or directories to work on. The entire working directory is assumed if this set is empty.
junkPaths - if true, the relative paths of added archive entries are discarded, i.e. they are all placed in the root of the archive.
compressionLevel - between 0 (store) and 9.
workingDirectory - working directory for zip command. If null, project directory root is used instead.
See Also:
ZIP

ZipCommand

public ZipCommand(String pathToZipFile,
                  File directoryToAdd)
Create a ZipCommand that adds an entire directory to an archive. The files directly in the directory will appear in the root of the archive. Default compression level is assumed.

Parameters:
pathToZipFile - path to archive to create or update
directoryToAdd - directory to add to the archive
See Also:
ZipCommand(Mode, String, Set, boolean, int, File)
Method Detail

getShellCommandInternal

protected ImmutableList<String> getShellCommandInternal(ExecutionContext context)
Description copied from class: ShellCommand
Implementations of this method should not have any observable side-effects. If any I/O needs to be done to produce the shell command arguments, then it should be done in ShellCommand.setup(ExecutionContext).

Specified by:
getShellCommandInternal in class ShellCommand

getShortName

public String getShortName(ExecutionContext context)
Returns:
a short name/description for the command, such as "javac". Should fit on one line.
